meico.mpm.elements

Class Header

  • java.lang.Object
    • meico.xml.AbstractXmlSubtree
      • meico.mpm.elements.Header

  • public class Header
extends AbstractXmlSubtree
    This class interfaces MPM header information.
    Author:
    Axel Berndt

      • addStyleType

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,GenericStyle> addStyleType(java.lang.String type)
        add a new empty style type to the header, if a type with this name is already existent, it will be replaced
        Parameters:
        type - the local name of the type, e.g. "tempoStyles" or "articulationStyles", use the constants in Mpm (e.g. Mpm.ARTICULATION_STYLE)
        Returns:
        the style collection just added, converted into a hashmap

      • addStyleType

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,GenericStyle> addStyleType(nu.xom.Element xml)
        add a style type and all its children to the header, if a type with this name is already existent, it will be replaced
        Parameters:
        xml - the element to be added
        Returns:
        the style collection just added, converted into a hashmap

      • addStyleDef

        public void addStyleDef(java.lang.String type,
                        GenericStyle styleDef)
        merge the specified styleDef into the specified style type
        Parameters:
        type - if the type doe not exist it will be generated
        styleDef - if there is already a styleDef with this name it will be replaced

      • addStyleDef

        public GenericStyle addStyleDef(java.lang.String type,
                                java.lang.String name)
        generate a new empty styleDef in the specified style type/collection
        Parameters:
        type - if the type doe not exist it will be generated
        name - if there is already a styleDef with this name it will be replaced
        Returns:
        the styleDef just added, this is a GenericStyle object, you should cast it to its specific type before working with it

      • removeStyleDef

        public void removeStyleDef(java.lang.String type,
                           java.lang.String name)
        remove the specified styleDef from the specified collection of styleDefs (style type)
        Parameters:
        type -
        name -

      • renameStyleDef

        public GenericStyle renameStyleDef(java.lang.String type,
                                   java.lang.String currentName,
                                   java.lang.String newName)
        Rename a styleDef. Caution: If there is already a styleDef with the newName it will be overwritten!
        Parameters:
        type -
        currentName -
        newName -
        Returns:
